TITLE: The U.S. economy and stocks face a difficult year — and could even lag Europe
SUMMARY: After a tough 2022, some strategists argue this year could be Europe's time to shine.

TITLE: The Davos elite like to make bold predictions. But they don't always get them right
SUMMARY: The World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, kicks off next week. Here's a recap of some of the calls made at the high-profile meeting in recent years.

TITLE: Putin's military command reshuffle reveals a power struggle at the heart of the Ukraine war
SUMMARY: Tension has been mounting in recent months between Russia's military commanders and Wagner Group leader Yevgeny Prigozhin.

TITLE: Tesla cuts prices in the U.S. and Europe to stoke sales after lackluster year-end deliveries
SUMMARY: Electric vehicle maker Tesla is cutting prices in the United States and throughout Europe again, according to listings on the company's website.

TITLE: Sweden finds Europe's largest deposit of rare earth metals, which could become 'more important than oil and gas'
SUMMARY: Swedish mining company LKAB discovered one million metric tons of rare earth oxides, which are used in electric vehicles and wind turbines.

TITLE: Biden advisor says oil price cap is working as Russia takes economic hit
SUMMARY: Amos Hochstein, special presidential coordinator to Joe Biden, told CNBC the G7's oil price cap had so far "achieved our interest."

TITLE: UK economy ekes out growth in November surprise — but recession still seen as inevitable
SUMMARY: A Reuters poll of economists had forecast a 0.2% contraction amid a bleak overall picture for the British economy.

TITLE: JPMorgan tops estimates for fourth-quarter revenue, but says mild recession is now 'central case’
SUMMARY: JPMorgan, the biggest U.S. bank by assets, now expects a recession as its most likely scenario.

TITLE: Scaramucci says SkyBridge can buy back FTX stake this year, alleges SBF 'committed fraud’
SUMMARY: SkyBridge Capital can buy back the stake it sold to FTX, founder Anthony Scaramucci told CNBC.

TITLE: Citigroup's fourth-quarter profit declines by 21% as bank sets aside more money for credit losses
SUMMARY: Citigroup reported fourth-quarter earnings on Friday. Here's how they did.

TITLE: Just one G-7 leader will join the Davos elite this year as regular people battle cost-of-living crisis
SUMMARY: While the WEF summit has had low G-7 attendance in the past, one political advisor said leaders would be especially wary amid the cost-of-living crisis.

TITLE: Trump Organization hit with $1.6 million fine for criminal tax fraud scheme
SUMMARY: Two subsidiaries of the Trump Organization, former President Donald Trump's business, were hit with fines of $1.6 million at sentencing.

TITLE: Scaramucci says SkyBridge can buy back FTX stake this year, alleges SBF committed fraud
SUMMARY: SkyBridge Capital can buy back the stake it sold to FTX, founder Anthony Scaramucci told CNBC.

TITLE: Four troubling global trade trends flashing consumer weakness for a market already fearing recession
SUMMARY: Global trade, manufacturing, and warehouse trends provide a picture of consumer health and the economy. It's not looking good right now.

TITLE: U.S. will hit its debt limit Thursday, start taking steps to avoid default, Yellen warns Congress
SUMMARY: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen wrote House Speaker Kevin McCarthy, "It is unlikely that cash and extraordinary measures will be exhausted before early June."

TITLE: 'Flash' star Ezra Miller avoids jail with plea deal for unlawful trespass in Vermont
SUMMARY: Ezra Miller, star of "The Flash," agreed to a plea deal to avoid jail related to an incident in which they allegedly stole alcohol from a neighbor's home.

TITLE: Brian Moynihan says Bank of America expects 'mild recession' and is preparing for worse
SUMMARY: The CEO's statement mirrors the earnings report for JPMorgan Chase, whose economic outlook calls for "a mild recession in the central case."

TITLE: CDC says it’s ‘very unlikely’ Pfizer booster carries stroke risk for seniors after launching review
SUMMARY: The CDC said one of its monitoring systems detected a preliminary safety signal for stroke in people ages 65 and older who received the Pfizer omicron booster.

TITLE: Judge unseals section of Trump deposition in rape-defamation lawsuit by writer E. Jean Carroll
SUMMARY: The writer E. Jean Carroll is suing Donald Trump for defaming her by saying she lied in claiming he raped her in the mid-1990s in New York City.

TITLE: Iran executes British-Iranian national despite UK, U.S. pleas
SUMMARY: British Foreign Secretary James Cleverly said late on Friday Iran must not follow through with the execution - a call echoed by the U.S. State Department.

TITLE: Crypto firms Genesis and Gemini charged by SEC with selling unregistered securities
SUMMARY: The SEC alleged on Thursday that crypto firm Gemini, founded by the Winklevoss twins, and Barry Silbert's Genesis offered and sold unregistered securities.

TITLE: A battle between Disney and activist Peltz brews. Here’s how the situation may unfold
SUMMARY: Activist investor Nelson Peltz wants a seat on Disney’s board, and a proxy fight may be simmering.

TITLE: Op-ed: Oil CEO Sultan Al Jaber is the ideal person to lead the UN climate conference this year
SUMMARY: Some climate activists were aghast when the UAE named the CEO of the Abu Dhabi National Oil Company (ADNOC) as president of this year's COP 28.

TITLE: Trump insults rape accuser Carroll in unsealed testimony, falsely says she indicated 'she loved it'
SUMMARY: Ex-president Donald Trump faces two defamation lawsuits by E. Jean Carroll, who accuses him of raping her in a New York City department store decades ago.
